previously named [[Dominion Day]] [[Canadians]] ([[Canada]]) July 1 yes 1 day annual same day each year Fireworks, parades, barbecues, concerts, carnivals, fairs, picnics national Historical, cultural, national Canada Day(lang-frFête du Canada) is theNational Daynational dayofCanada, aPublic holidays in Canadafederal statutory holidaycelebrating the anniversary of the July 1, 1867, enactment of theBritish North America Acts#British North America Act, 1867British North America Act, 1867(today called theConstitution Act, 1867), which united threeBritish colonization of the Americas#British colonies in North Americacoloniesinto a single country calledCanadawithin theBritish Empire.cite webhttp://www1.canadiana.org/citm/themes/constitution/constitution13_e.htmlCanada in the Making >Constitutional History >1867–1931: Becoming a NationCanadianaJune 16, 2011cite webhttp://atlas.nrcan.gc.ca/auth/english/maps/historical/territorialevolution/1867/1Department of Natural ResourcesNatural Resources CanadaNatural Resources Canada >Atlas Home >Explore Our Maps >History >Territorial Evolution >Territorial Evolution, 1867Queen's Printer for CanadaJune 16, 2011cite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?idMooreChristopher1867: How the Fathers Made a Deal2011215McClelland & Stewart978-1-55199-483-3June 30, 2013Originally calledDominion Day(lang-frLe Jour de la Confédération), the holiday was renamed in 1982, the year theCanada Act 1982Canada Actwas passed. Canada Day observances take place throughout Canada as well as among Canadians internationally.
article.heading: Commemoration
article.paragraph: Frequently referred to as "Canada's birthday", particularly in the popular press,Cite newsPanettaAlexanderPedwellTerryAn unforgettable Canada Day, eh?Toronto StarJuly 2, 2007http://www.thestar.com/article/231568May 12, 2007harv.Cite newsCanada Day celebrationsToronto StarJune 29, 2007http://www.thestar.com/article/230791May 12, 2007Cite newsCanwest News ServiceHarper salutes international role in Canada Day addressNational PostJuly 1, 2007http://www.canada.com/nationalpost/story.html?idMay 12, 2007the occasion marks the joining of theBritish North Americancolonies ofNova Scotia,New Brunswick, and theProvince of Canadainto a federation of four provinces (the Province of Canada being divided, in the process, intoOntarioandQuebec) on July 1, 1867. Canada became a kingdom in its own right on that date, called theDominion of Canada,refn<arg name="Canadian representatives had actually requested the title ''Kingdom of Canada'' be granted, to "fix the monarchical basis of the constitution", but the idea was vetoed by the [[Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs|British Foreign Secretary]] at the time, [[Edward Stanley, 15th Earl of Derby|the Lord Stanley]], and the title ''[[Dominion]]'' was used in its place.{{cite book| url">http://books.google.com/books?idnKingdomcite webhttp://www.saintjohn.nbcc.nb.ca/~HeritageSaintJohn/CorporateSeal/heraldry.htmHeritage Saint John &gt Canadian HeraldryHeritage Resources of Saint John and New Brunswick Community CollegeJuly 3, 2009cite webhttp://www.royal.gov.uk/MonarchAndCommonwealth/Canada/Historyandpresentgovernment.aspxThe Royal HouseholdThe Queen and the Commonwealth >Queen and Canada >History and present governmentQueen's PrinterJuly 3, 2009cite journalDepartment of Canadian HeritageDepartment of Canadian HeritageThe Crown in CanadaQueen's Printer for Canada20057http://dsp-psd.pwgsc.gc.ca/Collection/CH4-127-2003E.pdfJuly 3, 2009Cite documentDepartment of Canadian Heritagehttp://www.pch.gc.ca/pgm/ceem-cced/symbl/101/101-eng.pdfDepartment of Canadian HeritageCanada: Symbols of CanadaQueen's Printer for Canada3July 1, 2010but theParliament of the United KingdomBritish parliamentandCabinet of the United KingdomCabinetkept limited rights of political control over the new country that were shed by stages over the years until the last vestiges were surrendered in 1982, when theConstitution Act, 1982Constitution Actpatriated the Canadian constitution.refnAmong the powers retained by the Crown in its British Council between 1867 and 1931 was the power to declare war.nPowers

Under the federal Holidays Act,cite webhttp://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/acts/H-5/page-1.html#h-2Canada Department of JusticeHoliday Act1985Canada Department of JusticeJune 18, 2012Canada Day is observed on July 1, unless that date falls on a Sunday, in which case July 2 is the statutory holiday, although celebratory events generally take place on July 1, even though it is not the legal holiday.cite webhttp://www.gov.sk.ca/news?newsIdGovernment of SaskatchewanCanada Day to be observed Monday, July 2June 18, 2007Queen's Printer for SaskatchewanJanuary 23, 2010If it falls on a Saturday, any businesses normally closed that day will generally dedicate the following Monday as a day off.
article.heading: Activities
article.paragraph: Most communities across the country will host organized celebrations for Canada Day, usually outdoor public events, such as parades, carnivals, festivals, barbecues, air and maritime shows, fireworks, and free musical concerts,cite webhttp://www.canadianheritage.gc.ca/newsroom/index_e.cfm?fuseactionDepartment of Canadian HeritageDepartment of Canadian HeritageBritish Columbia and Yukon invited to participate to "Celebrate Canada!" DaysQueen's Printer for CanadaMay 31, 2008as well asOath of Citizenship (Canada)citizenship ceremoniesfor new citizens.cite webhttp://www.cic.gc.ca/English/citizenship/cit-ceremony.aspCitizenship and Immigration CanadaCitizenship and Immigration CanadaApplying for citizenship >The citizenship ceremonyQueen's Printer for CanadaJuly 1, 2009cite webhttp://www.rsscanadaimmigration.com/en/citizenship/citizenshipoath.phpCanadian Citizenship OathRobinson Sheppard ShapiroJuly 1, 2009There is no standard mode of celebration for Canada Day; professor of International Relations at the University of OxfordJennifer Welshsaid of this: "Canada Day, like the country, is endlessly decentralized. There doesn't seem to be a central recipe for how to celebrate itchalk it up to the nature of the federation."Cite newsAllemangJohnWe stand on guard for what?Globe and MailJune 28, 2008http://www.theglobeandmail.com/servlet/story/RTGAM.20080627.wcandayfocusdebate/BNStory/CanadaDay2008/?pageRequestedJuly 1, 2009However, the locus of the celebrations is the national capital,Ottawa, Ontario, where large concerts and cultural displays are held onParliament Hill, with theList of Governors General of Canadagovernor generalandList of Prime Ministers of Canadaprime ministertypically officiating, thoughMonarchy of Canadathe monarchor another member of theMonarchy of Canada#Royal family and houseRoyal Familymay also attend or take the governor general's place.refn<arg name="Queen [[Elizabeth II]] was present for the official Canada Day ceremonies in Ottawa in 1990, 1992, 1997,{{cite web| url">http://www.crht.ca/DiscoverMonarchyFiles/QueenElizabethII.html| lastnFoundSmaller events are mounted in other parks around the city and in Gatineau, Quebec.

Given the federal nature of the holiday, celebrating Canada Day can be a cause of friction in the province ofQuebec, where the holiday is overshadowed by Quebec'sNational Holiday (Quebec)National Holiday, on June 24.Cite newsFedioChloeCanada Day Parade organizers bemoan lack of political supportThe GazetteJune 17, 2010http://www.montrealgazette.com/health/Canada+Parade+organizers+bemoan+lack+political+support/3164763/story.htmlJuly 1, 2010yeshttps://web.archive.org/20100621051355/http://www.montrealgazette.com:80/health/Canada+Parade+organizers+bemoan+lack+political+support/3164763/story.html21 June 2010For example, the federal government funds Canada Day events at theOld Port of Montrealan area run by a federalCrown corporations of CanadaCrown corporationwhile the National Holiday parade is agrassrootseffort that has been met with pressure to cease, even from federal officials.Cite newsHustakeAalanProud Canadian, proud Quebecer who loved a paradeThe GazetteMay 25, 2008http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/insight/story.html?idMay 25, 2008The nature of the event has also been met with criticism outside of Quebec, such as that given byOttawa Citizencolumnist David Warren, who said in 2007: "The Canada of the government-funded paper flag-waving and painted facesthe 'new' Canada that is celebrated each year on what is now called 'Canada Day'has nothing controversially Canadian about it. You could wave a different flag, and choose another face paint, and nothing would be lost."Cite newsWarrenDavidSea to seaOttawa CitizenJuly 1, 2007http://www.davidwarrenonline.com/index.php?id

Canada Day also coincides with Quebec'sMoving Day (Quebec)Moving Day, when many fixed-lease apartment rental terms expire. The bill changing the province's moving day from May 1 to July 1 was introduced by a federalist member of theNational Assembly of QuebecQuebec National Assembly,Jrme Choquettein 1973,Cite newsLejtenyiPatrickMoving day conspiracyMontreal Mirrorhttp://www.montrealmirror.com/ARCHIVES/2002/070402/ncity.htmlJuly 1, 2009in order not to affect children still in school in the month of May.cite newsMadiganTraceyhttp://www.cbc.ca/montreal/features/movingday/Get a Move OnJune 28, 2005CBCJuly 1, 2010
article.heading: International celebrations
article.paragraph: File:A game of Canadian street hockey on Trafalgar Square.jpgthumbleftStreet hockeyonTrafalgar Square, in front of theNational Gallery, for Canada Day in London, EnglandCanadianexpatriateswill organize Canada Day activities in their local area on or near the date of the holiday. For instance, since 2006, annual Canada Day celebrations have been held atTrafalgar Squarethe location ofCanada Housein London, England; originally initiated by theCanadian community in the United KingdomCanadian community, endorsed by theHigh Commission of Canada in LondonCanadian High Commission, and now produced by Canada Day International, the event features Canadian performers, visual artists, astreet hockeytournament, among other activities.cite webhttp://www.canadadaylondon.com/default.aspCanada Day in LondonCanada Day LondonJune 27, 2012In 2013, Canada Day International expanded toNew York Citywith a similar program of food, music, and street hockey inCentral Park. They also announced that they planned to expand to more cities before Canada's sesquicentennial in 2017. They are currently exploring expanding to cities such as; Hong Kong, Mumbai, Paris, and Rio de Janeiro, among others.cite webhttp://www.canadadayinternational.com/new-york/about/About Canada Day International2013Canada Day InternationalJuly 1, 2015

Annual celebrations also take place in Hong Kong, entitledCanada D'ehand held on June 30 atLan Kwai Fong, where an estimated attendance of 12,000 was reported in 2008; inAfghanistan, where members of theCanadian Forcesmark the holiday at their base;cite press releaseAfghanistan Canada Day Celebrations Video Footage Available on WebsiteQueen's Printer for CanadaJune 29, 2006http://www.forces.gc.ca/site/news-nouvelles/view-news-afficher-nouvelles-eng.asp?idJuly 1, 2009cite newshttp://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20060629/afghanistan_canadaday_060701/20060701?hubTroops refuse to let attack mar Canada Day breakJuly 1, 2006CTVAugust 6, 2009and in Mexico, at theRoyal Canadian LegioninChapala, MexicoChapala,cite newshttp://news.nationalpost.com/2012/11/29/royal-canadian-legion-opens-branch-in-mexico/O'ConnorJoeAs Legions shutter across Canada, veterans open a new branch in 'friendly' MexicoNovember 29, 2012National postJune 29, 2013and the Canadian Club inAjijic.cite webCanada Clubhttp://www.canadianclubmx.com/2013Celebrate Canada Day with Your FriendsJune 29, 2013In China, Canada Day celebrations are held by theCanadian Chamber of Commerce in Shanghaiat the Bund Beach.cite newshttp://cancham.asia/canadaday/the-canadian-chamber-of-commerce-in-shanghai-to-celebrate-canadas-146th-anniversary/#sthash.5NV7agl9.dpbsThe Canadian Chamber of Commerce in Shanghai to Celebrate Canada’s 146th AnniversaryMay 17, 2013May 18, 2013

Detroit, Michigan, andWindsor, Ontario, have, since the 1950s, celebrated both Dominion or Canada Day and the United States'Independence Day (United States)Independence Daywith theWindsor-Detroit International Freedom FestivalInternational Freedom Festival; a massive fireworks display over theDetroit River, the strait separating the two cities, is held annually with hundreds of thousands of spectators attending. A similar event occurs at theFriendship Festival, a joint celebration betweenFort Erie, Ontario, and neighbouringBuffalo, New York, and towns and villages throughoutMaine,New Brunswick, andQuebeccome together to celebrate both anniversaries together.
article.heading: History

link.part: Crowds onParliament HillcelebrateDominion Day, 1927, thediamond jubileeof Confederation

article.paragraph: The enactment of theBritish North America Acts#British North America Act, 1867British North America Act, 1867(today called theConstitution Act, 1867), whichCanadian Confederationconfederated Canada, was celebrated on July 1, 1867, with the ringing of the bells at theCathedral Church of St. James (Toronto)Cathedral Church of St. Jamesin Toronto and "bonfires, fireworks and illuminations, excursions, military displays and musical and other entertainments", as described in contemporary accounts.cite newshttp://fullcomment.nationalpost.com/2013/06/29/allan-levine-the-evolution-of-july-1/LevineAllanThe evolution of July 1June 28, 2013National PostJune 30, 2013On June 20 of the following year,Governor General of CanadaGovernor GeneralCharles Stanley Monck, 4th Viscount Monckthe Viscount Monckissued a royalproclamationasking forCanadiansto celebrate the anniversary of Confederation,cite webhttp://www.pch.gc.ca/pgm/ceem-cced/jfa-ha/canada-eng.cfmDepartment of Canadian HeritageDepartment of Canadian HeritageCeremonial and Canadian Symbols Promotion >Canada DayQueen's Printer for CanadaJune 16, 2011However, the holiday was not established statutorily until May 15, 1879,cite webhttp://www.pch.gc.ca/eng/1359126121678/1359126177433Department of Canadian HeritageDepartment of Canadian HeritageDominion DayQueen's Printer for CanadaJuly 30, 2013October 12, 2013when it was designated asDominion Day, in reference to the designation of the country as aDominionin the British North America Act.cite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?idJamesPatrickKasoffMark J.Canadian Studies in the New MillenniumUniversity of Toronto Press452008978-0-8020-9468-1The holiday was initially not dominant in the national calendar; any celebrations were mounted by local communities and the governor general hosted a party atRideau Hall.No official celebrations were therefore held until 1917 and then none again for a further decadethe golden and diamond anniversaries of Confederation, respectively.cite newsCanadian HeritageCanada Day Background/How we got our national holidayCanoehttp://www.canoe.ca/Canadiana/canday.htmlJuly 1, 2009

In 1946,Philas Ct, a Quebec member of theHouse of Commons of CanadaHouse of Commons, introduced aprivate member's billto rename Dominion Day as Canada Day.Cite newsCarnegieR.K.Drew Right: Provinces Have Say-So On HolidaysThe Globe and Mail15April 19, 1946harv.His bill was passed quickly by the House of Commons but was stalled by theSenate of CanadaSenate, which returned the bill to the Commons with the recommendation that the holiday be renamedThe National Holiday of Canada, an amendment that effectively killed the bill.Cite newsEditorial BoardA New Low in CompromiseThe Globe and Mail6August 10, 1946

Beginning in 1958, the Canadian government began to orchestrate Dominion Day celebrations. That year, then Prime MinisterJohn Diefenbakerrequested that Secretary of StateEllen Faircloughput together appropriate events, with a budget of $14,000. Parliament was traditionally in session on July 1, but Fairclough persuaded Diefenbaker and the rest of theCabinet of Canadafederal Cabinetto attend.Official celebrations thereafter consisted usually ofTrooping the Colourceremonies onParliament Hillin the afternoon and evening, followed by a mass band concert and fireworks display, though Fairclough, who becameMinister of Citizenship and Immigration (Canada)Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, later expanded the bills to include performing folk and ethnic groups and the day became more casual and family oriented.Canadian CentennialCanada's centennialin 1967 is often seen as an important milestone in the history of Canadian patriotism and in Canada's maturing as a distinct, independent country, after which Dominion Day became more popular with average Canadians. Into the late 1960s, nationally televised, multi-cultural concerts held inOttawawere added and the fte became known asFestival Canada. After 1980, the Canadian government began to promote celebrating Dominion Day beyond the national capital, giving grants and aid to cities across the country to help fund local activities.File:Barrie Canada Day Fireworks.pngthumbleftCanada Day fireworks inBarrie, Ontario

Some Canadians were, by the early 1980s, informally referring to the holiday asCanada Day.refn<arg name="Numerous references to the term ''Canada Day'' may be found in issues of ''[[The Globe and Mail]]'' published in the late 1970s.<ref name">Sibley />{{Cite news| titlenNameHowever, this practice did cause some controversy:Numerous politicians, journalists, and authors, such asRobertson Davies,decried the change at the time and some continue to maintain that it was illegitimate and an unnecessary break with tradition.Proponents argued that the nameDominion Daywas a holdover from the colonial era, an argument given some impetus by thepatriationof theCanadian Constitutionin 1982, and others asserted that an alternative was needed as the term does not translate well into French.Conversely, these arguments were disputed by those who claimedDominionwas widely misunderstood and conservatively inclined commenters saw the change as part of a much larger attempt byLiberal Party of CanadaLiberalsto "re-brand" or re-define Canadian history.cite journalBentleyD.M.R.Essay 11: Parading PastMnemographia Canadensis19991Muse and Recallhttp://www.uwo.ca/english/canadianpoetry/architexts/mnemographia_canadensis/index.htmJuly 11, 2011cite newsWe should be celebrating Dominion Dayhttp://www.nationalpost.com/news/story.html?idJuly 11, 2011National PostColumnistAndrew Cohen (journalist)Andrew CohencalledCanada Daya term of "crushing banality" and criticized it as "a renunciation of the past [and] a misreading of history, laden with political correctness and historical ignorance".cite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?idCohenAndrewThe Unfinished Canadian: The People We Are2008McClelland & Stewart Limited90978-0-7710-2286-9File:Canada Ottawa William Kate 2011 (2).jpgthumbrightPrince William, Duke of CambridgeThe DukeandCatherine, Duchess of CambridgeDuchess of Cambridgeat the official Canada Day celebration in Ottawa, 2011

The holiday was officially renamed as a result of a private member's bill that, on July 9, 1982, two years after receivingReading (legislature)#First readingfirst readingin the House of Commons,there receivedReading (legislature)#Third readingthird readingwhen only twelve Members of Parliament (MPs) were present. (This was actually eight members less than aquorum, but, according to parliamentary rules, the quorum is enforceable only at the start of a sitting or when a member calls attention to it.Cite bookMarleauRobertMontpetitCamilleHouse of Commons Procedure and PracticeOttawaQueen's Printer for CanadaJanuary 2000http://www.parl.gc.ca/marleaumontpetit/DocumentViewer.aspx?Sec9. Sittings of the HouseNovember 28, 2011) The bill was passed by the House in five minutes, without debate,cite webhttp://archives.cbc.ca/society/celebrations//topics/2328/Society >Celebrations >Celebrating Canada DayCBCJuly 1, 2009which inspired "grumblings about the underhandedness of the process".It met with stronger resistance in the Senatesome Senators objected to the change of name;Ernest Manning, who argued that the rationale for the change was based on a misperception of the name, andGeorge McIlraith, who did not agree with the manner in which the bill had been passed and urged the government to proceed in a more "dignified way"but finally passed.cite newsSibleyRobertThe death of 'Dominion Day'http://www.canada.com/ottawacitizen/news/story.html?idSeptember 1, 2006The Ottawa CitizenJuly 11, 2011With the granting ofRoyal Assent, the name was officially changed to Canada Day on October 27, 1982.

Lobby groups and politicians since have occasionally campaigned to have the holiday named returned toDominion Day.cite newshttp://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2015/07/01/dominion-day-enthusiasts-pine-for-the-past.htmlDominion Day enthusiasts pine for the pastJuly 1, 2015Toronto StarfullJuly 2015In 1996,Reform Party of CanadaMPStephen Harperintroduced a private member's bill to reinstate the name. It was defeated.In 2012,Conservative Party of CanadaMPBrad Trostmade a speech in the House of Commons favouring the reinstatement of theDominion Dayname.

As the anniversary of Confederation, Dominion Day, and later Canada Day, was the date set for a number of important events, such as the first national radio network hookup by the Canadian National Railway (1927); the inauguration of theCanadian Broadcasting CorporationCBC's cross-country television broadcast, with Governor GeneralVincent Massey's Dominion Day speech from Parliament Hill (1958);the flooding of theSaint Lawrence Seaway(1958); the first colour television transmission in Canada (1966); the inauguration of theOrder of Canada(1967); and the establishment of "O Canada" as the country'snational anthem(1980). Other events fell on the same day coincidentally, such as thefirst day on the Sommefirst day of the Battle of the Sommein 1916shortly after whichDominion of NewfoundlandNewfoundlandrecognized July 1 asMemorial Day (Newfoundland and Labrador)Memorial Dayto commemorate theNewfoundland Regiment's heavy losses during the battlecite webhttp://www.heritage.nf.ca/society/custom.htmlHiscockPhilipSociety and Culture >Folklore and Traditional Culture >CustomMemorial University of NewfoundlandJune 18, 2008cite webhttp://www.mun.ca/memorial/living/memorial_day.phpA Living Memorial >Memorial DayMemorial University of NewfoundlandMay 31, 2008and the enactment of theChinese Immigration Act, 1923Chinese Immigration Actin 1923leadingChinese-Canadiansto refer to July 1 asHumiliation Dayand boycott Dominion Day celebrations until the act was repealed in 1947.cite newsCBC News >Indepth >China >Chinese ImmigrationCBCJune 10, 2004http://www.cbc.ca/news/background/china/chinese_immigration.htmlJuly 1, 2009
